Message.Title: IBM plans to hire 500 in Nova Scotia
Message.Msg: November 8, 2012 - 11:44am By CHRIS LAMBIE Business Editor IBM is planning to hire 500 people in Nova Scotia over eight years to staff a new global delivery centre. Nova Scotia is offering IBM a payroll rebate of as much as $12.2 million if the massive company reaches that job target. “We're providing them a payroll rebate to incent them to grow 500 new jobs in Nova Scotia,” Stephen Lund, who heads Nova Scotia Business Inc., the province's business lending arm, told The Chronicle Herald's editorial board. “These guys are considered one of the top brands in the world today., and one of the top employers in the world today. So the ramp-up will start right away.” Premier Darrell Dexter is announcing the project this morning at the Dartmouth waterfront campus of the Nova Scotia Community College. The jobs will be phased in over time, he said. More at the thechronicleherald website w/internet country code .ca

Message.Title: Before the Fiscal Cliff the US Debt Ceiling Needs to Be Raised
Message.Msg: Could be necessary in December. This is not going to be an easy process. The House Republicans who identify with Cantor or the Tea Party are going to be very difficult to deal with. I think this could rattle the markets big time. I don't think that the House will vote to lift the debt ceiling for more than a quarter or two at a time until there is a budget.
